title: Forces - Systems with different internal forces

content.description: In Scenarios <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"> <mn>1</mn> </math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, Block <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> hangs from a string that passes over a pulley and is attached to cart <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>. In Scenario <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, Cart <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is attached to Cart <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> by a string. In Scenario <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, Cart <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is attached to Cart <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> by a spring, as shown in the figure. Frictional forces in both scenarios are negligible. When the carts-block systems in scenarios <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> are released from rest, the accelerations of the hanging block <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi>Z</mi></math> in the two scenarios as functions of time are <math alttext="a sub 1 of t" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>a</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>t</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math> and <math alttext="a sub 2 of t" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>t</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>, respectively.
content.question: Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="a sub 1 of t" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>a</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>t</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math> and <math alttext="a sub 2 of t" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>a</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>t</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math> and provides a correct justification?

choices.label: <math alttext="a sub 1 of t equals a sub 2 of t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mstyle></math>, because the net external force exerted on both systems is the same.

<math alttext="a sub 1 of t equals a sub 2 of t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mstyle></math>, because the tension in the string connecting the Block <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> to Cart <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is determined by the masses of Cart <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> and Block <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>.

<math alttext="a sub 1 of t is not equal to a sub 2 of t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>≠</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mstyle></math>, because the net external force exerted on each system is different.

<math alttext="a sub 1 of t is not equal to a sub 2 of t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>≠</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mstyle></math>, because the tension in the string connected to Block <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi>Z</mi></math> is constant in one system but not in the other.

content.answer: <math alttext="a sub 1 of t is not equal to a sub 2 of t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>≠</mo><msub><mi>a</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mstyle></math>, because the tension in the string connected to Block <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mi>Z</mi></math> is constant in one system but not in the other.
